title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 335.17 - Definition
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 335.17 - Definition

State Regulations
A
probationary appointment
shall be an
appointment for a period of one year which must be granted to a professional
employee holding a professional title in which permanent appointment may be
granted at a college of the university when the employee is appointed to a
different professional title in which permanent appointment may be granted at
the same college, or when the employee is appointed to a professional title
listed in Appendix B-1, infra, of this Part at the same college. In addition, three-month probationary appointments shall be provided on initial appointment
of any full-time professional in a teaching hospital position at a SUNY Article
28 facility whose professional obligation will include patient facing duties
(in-person patient care or service). A probationary appointment may be
terminated at any time in accordance with section
335.9
or
335.15
of this

Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
335.17

New

York State Register May 15, 2024/Volume XLVI, Issue 20, eff. 5/15/2024

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
